intro: Hieracium perclusum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in rough, hairy texture. Its leaves are lance-shaped, with a serrated margin, and its yellow flowers bloom from June to September. Hieracium perclusum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through rhizomes.
